result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwonn Raymond Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence.
Zero credit days.

miscConds.notes: $518.00 due through DOC COLLECT within 6 months of release to community in other sentences.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with victim KNW or her family.

Must submit to HIV testing.
Must submit to DNA testing.  All results to the victim.
Must register Lifetime to Sex Offender Registry and treatment.
Follow all rules.
Any other assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwonn Raymond Simmons
